words.definition: An acrobat is a person who performs difficult physical acts, like jumping or balancing.
words.example: The acrobat performed amazing tricks high above the ground.

words.definition: Advocacy is the act of supporting a particular cause or policy.
words.example: The group is known for its advocacy of environmental protection.

words.definition: If something is communal, it is shared by a group of people.
words.example: The apartment building has a communal garden for all the residents.

words.definition: A fluid is a substance, like a liquid or gas, that can flow easily.
words.example: Water is a common type of fluid.

words.definition: To harmonize means to be in agreement or to match well.
words.example: The colors of the room harmonize perfectly with the furniture.

words.definition: If someone is industrious, they work very hard.
words.example: The industrious student spent all weekend studying for the exam.

words.definition: If someone is inventive, they are good at thinking of new ideas.
words.example: She is a very inventive cook who creates her own recipes.

words.definition: If something is judicial, it relates to a court or a judge.
words.example: The judicial system is responsible for interpreting the law.

words.definition: Mandarin is the official form of the Chinese language.
words.example: He is learning to speak Mandarin so he can work in China.

words.definition: If something is metropolitan, it relates to a large city.
words.example: The metropolitan area includes the city and its surrounding suburbs.

words.definition: To mimic someone means to copy the way they speak or act.
words.example: The parrot can mimic many different sounds.

words.definition: If something is misguided, it is based on bad judgment or wrong information.
words.example: His decision to quit his job was misguided.

words.definition: To rehearse means to practice something before a performance.
words.example: The band spent hours rehearsing for the concert.

words.definition: Scorn is a strong feeling that someone or something is not worth respect.
words.example: He spoke with scorn about the company's new policies.

words.definition: If something is sensory, it relates to the physical senses.
words.example: The museum has many sensory exhibits that you can touch and smell.

words.definition: A staple is a basic food that is eaten regularly by a group of people.
words.example: Rice is a staple in many Asian diets.

words.definition: A statute is a formal law that is passed by a government.
words.example: The new statute aims to reduce pollution in the city.

words.definition: A veteran is a person who has a lot of experience in a particular area.
words.example: The team was led by a veteran player with many years of experience.

words.definition: A villain is a bad person in a story or movie.
words.example: The hero defeated the villain and saved the city.

words.definition: A vine is a plant that grows up walls or around other plants.
words.example: The grapes grow on a vine in the garden.
